item.title: 【Music Videos】Madcon - Beggin' (Original Version) [1080p / PCM 16-bit 48 kHz]
item.description:
Genre: Hip Hop
Style: Pop Rap
Year: 2007
Video Source: Apple Music, thanks Brungor
Audio Source: DVD, Promo, PCM 16-bit 48 kHz

"Beggin'" is a song composed by Bob Gaudio and Peggy Farina and first released as a single by American band the Four Seasons in 1967. Initially charting at number 16 in the US, the song became popular in the Northern soul scene in the United Kingdom in the 1970s. It has been covered multiple times, with versions by Norwegian hip-hop duo Madcon and Italian rock band Måneskin topping music charts in Europe and beyond. The Four Seasons' version was remixed in 2007 by French DJ Pilooski and re-released as a single, reaching number 32 in the UK and commercially outperforming the Four Seasons' original release there.

In 2007, the same year as the Pilooski remix, Norwegian hip-hop duo Madcon released a new version of the song with tweaked lyrics and added rap verses. Madcon's version of the song is a total re-recording, with all instruments were performed by production team 3Elementz (Hitesh Ceon, Kim Ofstad, Jonny Sjo) and all vocals by Madcon. This version reached number one on Norway's VG-lista chart for 12 nonconsecutive weeks and received the "Hit of the Year" Spellemannprisen award.

The single also became popular throughout Europe; in France, the Netherlands, and the Wallonia region of Belgium, it peaked at number one. It reached number five in the United Kingdom and number seven in Germany. Overall, "Beggin'" was Europe's 11th-most-successful single of 2008.

The music video, directed by Christian Holm-Glad, features Yosef Wolde-Mariam and Tshawe Baqwa in a mix of Blaxploitation scenes and dozing off while playing Halo 3.

As of May, 2023, Madcon's version of Beggin' has reached 215.4 million total views and 3.3 million likes on YouTube.

Release Info
The video track is downloaded from Apple Music by Brungor. It's the best version that I could find.
I've tried if upscaling the DVD release gave a better resulkt, but it didn't. The quality is too bad.
The PCM track is lossless (DVD, Promo, PCM 16-bit 48 kHz), synced with Adobe Audition.
The timed lyrics are synced and edited to match the music video.
Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.

item.description:
Winx Club is an animated series co-produced by Rainbow SpA and later Nickelodeon. It was created by Italian animator Iginio Straffi. The show is set in a magical universe that is inhabited by fairies, witches, and other mythical creatures. The main character is a fairy warrior named Bloom, who enrolls at Alfea College to train and hone her skills
------------------
I hope you'll enjoy release cuz it's hard to grab series from this site, especially after recent update..
But nothing is impossible!

In all episodes there's a watermark that moves from corner to corner, but it is almost imperceptible and it will not interfere!

item.title: 【Requests】[REQ PIC] - GERAINT THOMAS & PRIMOZ ROGLIC
item.description: Hi. Is there any chance someone might be able to share some nice photos of cyclists Geraint Thomas and Primoz Roglic from the Giro D'Italia cycle race that has just finished, please? I'd particularly love any large, un-watermarked pics of the two of them on the stage on the final day in Rome, but any pics of them from throughout the tour would be great, especially ones so Geraint on stage at the end of stage 10 of the race in Viareggio or Geraint or Primoz on stage during the sign-in presentations the following morning (stage 11) in Camaiore. Hope someone can help. Thanks in advance.
item.author: Pant-hooting Chimp

item.title: 【Requests】[REQ VID] - MGMT - "Alien Days" [live on Jimmy Fallon, 2013] {WEB EXCLUSIVE from NBC site}
item.description:
They did "Plenty of Girls in the Sea" on TV in scuba diving gear -
- and "Alien Days" was a companion web exclusive performance on NBC site, which, as turns out, nobody in MGMT fan-community recorded, so now it is lost. As you can see on these publicity stills, Andrew VanWyngarden inhaled some helium in the beginning, because on the album the first few lines of a song were sung by a child:



And HD upgrade of "Plenty of Girls in the Sea" performance would also be great!

item.description:
